Package org.opends.server.admin.client.cli

Class SecureConnectionCliArgs

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.admin.client.cli.SecureConnectionCliArgs
  • public final class SecureConnectionCliArgs
extends Object
    This is a commodity class that can be used to check the arguments required to establish a secure connection in the command line. It can be used to generate an ApplicationTrustManager object based on the options provided by the user in the command line.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SecureConnectionCliArgs​(boolean alwaysUseSSL)
      Creates a new instance of secure arguments.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecureConnectionCliArgs

        public SecureConnectionCliArgs​(boolean alwaysUseSSL)
        Creates a new instance of secure arguments.
        Parameters:
        alwaysUseSSL - Whether to always use the SSL connection type. In this case, the arguments useSSL and startTLS are not present.

      • argumentsPresent

        public boolean argumentsPresent()
        Indicates whether any of the arguments are present.
        Returns:
        boolean where true indicates that at least one of the arguments is present

      • getAdministratorUID

        public String getAdministratorUID()
        Get the admin UID which has to be used for the command.
        Returns:
        The admin UID specified by the command line argument, or the default value, if not specified.

      • getTruststoreFileFromConfig

        public String getTruststoreFileFromConfig()
                                   throws ConfigException
        Returns the absolute path of the trust store file that appears on the config. Returns null if the trust store is not defined or it does not exist.
        Returns:
        the absolute path of the trust store file that appears on the config.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if there is an error reading the configuration.

      • getAdminPortFromConfig

        public int getAdminPortFromConfig()
                           throws ConfigException

        Returns:
        the admin port from the configuration.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if an error occurs reading the configuration.

      • getPortFromConfig

        public int getPortFromConfig()
        Returns the port to be used according to the configuration and the arguments provided by the user. This method should be called after the arguments have been parsed.
        Returns:
        the port to be used according to the configuration and the arguments provided by the user.
